intro: Leucanthemopsis alpina subsp. alpina, commonly known as the alpine leucanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of silvery-white, woolly leaves. The plant produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and alpine gardens.
